title: The Wisdom o PCKF!
content:
I thought it might be a good time to have a little more talk in the forums, and here's a fun topic idea I got today for reasons unknown. So..

Tell what kind of wisdom you have learned at PCKF, oh guardians of wisdom, and bearded ones! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smoke2.gif[/img]


Here's two pretty good tips I've learned here. There are probably a lot more but can't remember more at the moment.

1. If possible, read books in the language they're originally written in. Big thanks to eK for this tip!

2. Your own emotions can (likely) make you interpret other people wrong. Thanks Djaser.. I should've realized this one long ago.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oldy.gif[/img]


And here's one piece of advice I can share:

When travelling, keep your money in several places! This way you don't lose everything or half of everything if you get robbed.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: my wisdom
content:
I only have this one right now, maybe I can remember others later!

Don't wait with shaving for several weeks. It'll hurt when you finally get there! I found this out yesterday [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] [hr]The human brain is not user-friendly...

title: Re: my wisdom
content:
Things I have learned.

1.) If it just doesn't matter, it just doesn't matter.

2.) Too much attention can be tiring, too little attention can be disasterous.

3.) Information is twice as valuble if acessable.

4.) Honour your debts and be indebted to your honours.

5.) Loose an hour in the morning and you'll be chasing it all day.

6.) Appetite is life's spice, variety is another.

7.) People only listen to you because they're thinking of what to say next.

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: my wisdom
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Don't wait with shaving for several weeks. It'll hurt when you finally get there![hr][/quote]
AMEN BROTHER! Say it louder!

[quote]Quote:[hr]Loose an hour in the morning and you'll be chasing it all day.[hr][/quote]
Um... Levellord how did you learn that from the PCKF?


Want to know what I learned?

NO ONE CARES IF YOU DON'T LIKE PRESIDENT BUSH!
This is not directed at any specific member of the PCKF. Any relation to persons, real or otherwise, is purely coincidence.

title: Re: my wisdom
content:
Wow, LL, you've learned a lot here! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: my wisdom
content:
That it's 'just' internet and therefore nothing here or on any other forum should be taken serious, fortunately or unfortunately.-----------------
[img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/s/jcw/img/logo_jamster_navi.gif[/img][img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/storage/view/335/0/cr/CrazyFrog___Axel_F_Falling.gif[/img]

title: Re: my wisdom
content:
However, to some and at some times, it becomes more than just 'just' hence flamewars and online tiffs.A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: my wisdom
content:
Yes, that's very true. For some it's just as good as someone personally telling them something.

Anyways, I'm disappointed that only a few has posted any wisdom! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: my wisdom
content:
The point is that it's almost always an illusion that it's so bad.

The person behind the offense doesn't really know you and has forgotten about it five minutes later. It means nothing and therefore you should not take it serious.-----------------
[img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/s/jcw/img/logo_jamster_navi.gif[/img][img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/storage/view/335/0/cr/CrazyFrog___Axel_F_Falling.gif[/img]

title: Re: my wisdom
content:
The biggest thing I learned from the PCKF is that there's actually a Keen community, although it's in large part an overall/general/fun/random forum as well.
Still, it's just that bit more than random talk about a game in the developer forum here, some random talk in a random shoutbox there, some random talk on a random guestbook somewhere else, some random random on... eh... I lost my train of thought.Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: my wisdom
content:
"The closer to the truth, the better the lie, and the truth itself, when it can be used, is the best lie of all."[quote]Quote:[hr]Just remember that this is the year of the elite devil.

1337 + 666 = 2003[hr][/quote][img]http://img259.imageshack.us/img259/3852/sheepsmall0sf.jpg[/img]

title: Re: my wisdom
content:
But what *is* the truth? Are all our truths just very good lies? So good we don't know they're wrong?A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: my wisdom
content:
So I guess the latter part of the quote is redundant, as the truth can never actually be used. But if it could, it'd be the best lie :P[quote]Quote:[hr]Just remember that this is the year of the elite devil.

1337 + 666 = 2003[hr][/quote][img]http://img259.imageshack.us/img259/3852/sheepsmall0sf.jpg[/img]
